>--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, Bill de h=D3ra <dehora@e...> wrote:
>=
> To me Mike, you're coming across as rude.

s rude?
>http://groups.yahoo.com/group/junit/message/6415

You didn't ask m=
e, but I don't find it particularly rude. I think the
joke about Canadians =
being unusually polite might put some people off,
but being Canadian, I und=
erstand.

>To me, it smacks of self-righteousness and shameless self-promot=
ion.

You know what, that's not so bad. When I do good work that I think
he=
lps people, I promote it. If they find it good, they also promote it.
If th=
ey find it bad, they tell me and I stop promoting it.

I wrote "JUnit: A St=
arter Guide" in response to two solid weeks of
complaining on this list abo=
ut how crappy the JUnit documentation is.
About four people in a row said t=
hey wanted a tutorial and I wrote one,
then found some other good ones on t=
he web. Mike Clark put together a
FAQ to go along side his excellent tutori=
al. Among us all, I think we
have the tutorial angle covered. Several thous=
and people have read that
document and I haven't seen a single complaint on=
 this list since that
time. That was about a year ago.

Let me ask you, am =
I wrong to be proud of that and to refer people to
it if they ask for a tut=
orial?

>I didn't come here to have some guy and his buddy disparage the id=
eas 
>that I offer without offering anything in exchange other than, "This =

>is how it is.  Buy my book!"

See, this is just sad. First, I'm not "his =
buddy". Dave and I have
exchanged the odd e-mail, but we hardly know each o=
ther. We respect
each other's work (at least I hope), but that's all. I tru=
st that Dave
will tackle your problem in an upcoming Coad letter. I thought=
 it was
rude of you to insist he get off his ass and answer your question r=
ight
now. That was how I saw your comment. Just because the man didn't want=

to type a long answer right that second doesn't mean that he didn't
have a=
 good answer and it doesn't mean that he wasn't going to share
his answer. =
And OF COURSE if he has written the answer in a book, I
don't blame him for=
 wanting you to buy the book, rather than get his
advice free. Be aware tha=
t we could be charging hundreds of dollars per
day for our advice. We are v=
olunteers here.

>I think if a person jumps into a discussion and says, "Yo=
ur approach 
>sucks.  Buy my book!" they should at least explain why.  That=
 might 
>actually be helpful to others.

I honestly didn't see "Your approa=
ch sucks". I hope that my other reply
made it clearer what I think Dave was=
 getting at: most people
misunderstand (as I did for two years) why the cla=
ss TestCase is meant
to embody a test fixture. The fact that it's named Tes=
tCase is a source
of confusion. Kent admitted that himself!

>> Yet, I have=
n't 
>> seen any explanation as to what is inferior in your approach - 
>> =
asserting it's inferior does not make it so.
>
>I couldn't agree more.

If =
I say "you should brush your teeth", do you attack me? The bottom
line is t=
hat you *should* brush your teeth, assuming that you want good
dental healt=
h and your teeth to last a long time. If you don't care
about dental health=
, or if your teeth are magical and stay clean all on
their own, or if not b=
rushing your teeth hasn't affected your life to
this point, then certainly,=
 continue not brushing your teeth.

HOWEVER, if later on your teeth all fal=
l out and you don't like what
that does to you, then you make look back on =
my advice and say, "You
know, perhaps I should have brushed my teeth."

So =
you can take it as you like. Either assume that we're Just Trying To
Help o=
r assume that we're out to disparage you. Your choice. If you
choose to bel=
ieve that we're out to disparage you, then please
understand when we say th=
at we know better than you know what our
intentions are.

>> I also found t=
he waving 
>> of the moderator stick distasteful; it's far too early for th=
at.
>> 
>> A suggestion - stop posting for 24 hours on this thread, then co=
me 
>> back to it.
>> 
>> Bill de h=D3ra
>
>Whoops, too late for that!  Heh=
eh.
>
>For the record, I never said I disagreed with what Dave and J. B. ar=
e 
>advocating.  I never said I didn't like them personally, either.  
>It'=
s the delivery of their message I find curious.  It seems more 
>geared tow=
ard self-interest than equitable exchange or mutual benefit.

I would love =
for you to show me where, in my reply, you felt that my
advice was delivere=
d with self-interest as opposed to YOUR benefit,
nevermind MUTUAL benefit. =
At least one of us will be able to learn from
that exercise, and probably b=
oth.

I mean messages 6421, 6435 and 6442 up until the point that I objecte=
d
to what I perceived as your rudeness.
